an9.52:4.2: In what way did the Buddha speak of a safe place?”
an9.52:5.1: “First, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures …
an9.52:5.2: enters and remains in the first absorption.
an9.52:5.3: Thus far the Buddha spoke of a safe place in a qualified sense. …
an9.52:6.1: Furthermore, take a mendicant who, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling. And, having seen with wisdom, their defilements come to an end.
an9.52:6.2: Thus far the Buddha spoke of a safe place in an unqualified sense.”
